Raag Basant − Part 001 1168 : 1 Raag Basant, First Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas, Du−Tukas: 1168 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 1168 : 3 Among the months, blessed is this month, when spring always comes. 1168 : 4 Blossom forth, O my consciousness, contemplating the Lord of the Universe, forever and ever. ||1|| 1168 : 5 O ignorant one, forget your egotistical intellect. 1168 : 6 Subdue your ego, and contemplate Him in your mind; gather in the virtues of the Sublime, Virtuous Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1168 : 7 Karma is the tree, the Lord's Name the branches, Dharmic faith the flowers, and spiritual wisdom the fruit. 1168 : 8 Realization of the Lord are the leaves, and eradication of the pride of the mind is the shade. ||2|| 2

1168 : 9 Whoever sees the Lord's Creative Power with his eyes, and hears the Guru's Bani with his ears, and utters the True Name with his mouth, 1168 : 10 attains the perfect wealth of honor, and intuitively focuses his meditation on the Lord. ||3|| 1168 : 11 The months and the seasons come; see, and do your deeds. 1168 : 12 O Nanak, those Gurmukhs who remain merged in the Lord do not wither away; they remain green forever. ||4||1|| 1168 : 13 First Mehl, Basant: 1168 : 14 The season of spring, so delightful, has come. 1168 : 15 Those who are imbued with love for You, O Lord, chant Your Name with joy. 1168 : 16 Whom else should I worship? At whose feet should I bow? ||1|| 1168 : 17 I am the slave of Your slaves, O my Sovereign Lord King. 1168 : 18 Raag Basant − Part 001 3

O Life of the Universe, there is no other way to meet You. ||1||Pause|| 1168 : 19 You have only One Form, and yet You have countless forms. 1168 : 20 Which one should I worship? Before which one should I burn incense? 1168 : 21 Your limits cannot be found. How can anyone find them? 1168 : 22 I am the slave of Your slaves, O my Sovereign Lord King. ||2|| 1168 : 23 The cycles of years and the places of pilgrimage are Yours, O Lord. 1168 : 24 Your Name is True, O Transcendent Lord God. 1168 : 25 Your State cannot be known, O Eternal, Unchanging Lord God. 1168 : 26 Although You are unknown, still we chant Your Name. ||3|| 1168 : 27 What can poor Nanak say? 1168 : 28 Raag Basant − Part 001 4

All people praise the One Lord. 1168 : 29 Nanak places his head on the feet of such people. 1168 : 30 I am a sacrifice to Your Names, as many as there are, O Lord. ||4||2|| 1168 : 31 Basant, First Mehl: 1168 : 32 The kitchen is golden, and the cooking pots are golden. 1168 : 33 The lines marking the cooking square are silver. 1168 : 34 The water is from the Ganges, and the firewood is sanctified. 1168 : 35 The food is soft rice, cooked in milk. ||1|| 1168 : 36 O my mind, these things are worthless, −− Raag Basant − Part 001 −− Raag Basant − Part 001 5

Raag Basant − Part 002 1169 : 37 if you are not drenched with the True Name. ||1||Pause|| 1169 : 38 One may have the eighteen Puraanas written in his own hand; 1169 : 39 he may recite the four Vedas by heart, 1169 : 40 and take ritual baths at holy festivals and give charitable donations; 1169 : 41 he may observe the ritual fasts, and perform religious ceremonies day and night. ||2|| 1169 : 42 He may be a Qazi, a Mullah or a Shaykh, 1169 : 43 a Yogi or a wandering hermit wearing saffron−colored robes; 1169 : 44 he may be a householder, working at his job; 1169 : 45 but without understanding the essence of devotional worship, all people are eventually bound and gagged, and driven along by the Messenger of Death. ||3|| 6

1169 : 46 Each person's karma is written on his forehead. 1169 : 47 According to their deeds, they shall be judged. 1169 : 48 Only the foolish and the ignorant issue commands. 1169 : 49 O Nanak, the treasure of praise belongs to the True Lord alone. ||4||3|| 1169 : 50 Basant, Third Mehl: 1169 : 51 A person may take off his clothes and be naked. 1169 : 52 What Yoga does he practice by having matted and tangled hair? 1169 : 53 If the mind is not pure, what use is it to hold the breath at the Tenth Gate? 1169 : 54 The fool wanders and wanders, entering the cycle of reincarnation again and again. ||1|| 1169 : 55 Meditate on the One Lord, O my foolish mind, Raag Basant − Part 002 7

1169 : 56 and you shall cross over to the other side in an instant. ||1||Pause|| 1169 : 57 Some recite and expound on the Simritees and the Shaastras; 1169 : 58 some sing the Vedas and read the Puraanas; 1169 : 59 but they practice hypocrisy and deception with their eyes and minds. 1169 : 60 The Lord does not even come near them. ||2|| 1169 : 61 Even if someone practices such self−discipline, 1169 : 62 compassion and devotional worship 1169 : 63 − if he is filled with greed, and his mind is engrossed in corruption, 1169 : 64 how can he find the Immaculate Lord? ||3|| 1169 : 65 What can the created being do? Raag Basant − Part 002 8

1169 : 66 The Lord Himself moves him. 1169 : 67 If the Lord casts His Glance of Grace, then his doubts are dispelled. 1169 : 68 If the mortal realizes the Hukam of the Lord's Command, he obtains the True Lord. ||4|| 1169 : 69 If someone's soul is polluted within, 1169 : 70 what is the use of his traveling to sacred shrines of pilgrimage all over the world? 1169 : 71 O Nanak, when one joins the Society of the True Guru, 1169 : 72 then the bonds of the terrifying world−ocean are broken. ||5||4|| 1169 : 73 Basant, First Mehl: 1169 : 74 All the worlds have been fascinated and enchanted by Your Maya, O Lord. 1169 : 75 I do not see any other at all − You are everywhere. Raag Basant − Part 002 9

1169 : 76 You are the Master of Yogis, the Divinity of the divine. 1169 : 77 Serving at the Guru's Feet, the Name of the Lord is received. ||1|| 1169 : 78 O my Beauteous, Deep and Profound Beloved Lord. 1169 : 79 As Gurmukh, I sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name. You are Infinite, the Cherisher of all. ||1||Pause|| 1169 : 80 Without the Holy Saint, association with the Lord is not obtained. 1169 : 81 Without the Guru, one's very fiber is stained with filth. 1169 : 82 Without the Lord's Name, one cannot become pure. 1169 : 83 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, sing the Praises of the True Lord. ||2|| 1169 : 84 O Savior Lord, that person whom You have saved 1169 : 85 − You lead him to meet the True Guru, and so take care of him. Raag Basant − Part 002 10

1169 : 86 You take away his poisonous egotism and attachment. 1169 : 87 You dispel all his sufferings, O Sovereign Lord God. ||3|| 1169 : 88 His state and condition are sublime; the Lord's Glorious Virtues permeate his body. 1169 : 89 Through the Word of the Guru's Teachings, the diamond of the Lord's Name is revealed. 1169 : 90 He is lovingly attuned to the Naam; he is rid of the love of duality. 1169 : 91 O Lord, let servant Nanak meet the Guru. ||4||5|| 1169 : 92 Basant, First Mehl: 1169 : 93 O my friends and companions, listen with love in your heart. 1169 : 94 My Husband Lord is Incomparably Beautiful; He is always with me. 1169 : 95 He is Unseen − He cannot be seen. How can I describe Him? Raag Basant − Part 002 11
−− Raag Basant − Part 002 −− Raag Basant − Part 002 12

Raag Basant − Part 003 1170 : 96 The Guru has shown me that my Sovereign Lord God is with me. ||1|| 1170 : 97 Joining together with my friends and companions, I am adorned with the Lord's Glorious Virtues. 1170 : 98 The sublime soul−brides play with their Lord God. The Gurmukhs look within themselves; their minds are filled with faith. ||1||Pause|| 1170 : 99 The self−willed manmukhs, suffering in separation, do not understand this mystery. 1170 : 100 The Beloved Lord of all celebrates in each and every heart. 1170 : 101 The Gurmukh is stable, knowing that God is always with him. 1170 : 102 The Guru has implanted the Naam within me; I chant it, and meditate on it. ||2|| 1170 : 103 Without the Guru, devotional love does not well up within. 1170 : 104 Without the Guru, one is not blessed with the Society of the Saints. 13

1170 : 105 Without the Guru, the blind cry out, entangled in worldly affairs. 1170 : 106 That mortal who becomes Gurmukh becomes immaculate; the Word of the Shabad washes away his filth. ||3|| 1170 : 107 Uniting with the Guru, the mortal conquers and subdues his mind. 1170 : 108 Day and night, he savors the Yoga of devotional worship. 1170 : 109 Associating with the Saint Guru, suffering and sickness are ended. 1170 : 110 Servant Nanak merges with his Husband Lord, in the Yoga of intuitive ease. ||4||6|| 1170 : 111 Basant, First Mehl: 1170 : 112 By His Creative Power, God fashioned the creation. 1170 : 113 The King of kings Himself adminsters true justice. 1170 : 114 The most sublime Word of the Guru's Teachings is always with us. Raag Basant − Part 003 14

1170 : 115 The wealth of the Lord's Name, the source of nectar, is easily acquired. ||1|| 1170 : 116 So chant the Name of the Lord; do not forget it, O my mind. 1170 : 117 The Lord is Infinite, Inaccessible and Incomprehensible; His weight cannot be weighed, but He Himself allows the Gurmukh to weigh Him. ||1||Pause|| 1170 : 118 Your GurSikhs serve at the Guru's Feet. 1170 : 119 Serving the Guru, they are carried across; they have abandoned any distinction between 'mine' and 'yours'. 1170 : 120 The slanderous and greedy people are hard−hearted. 1170 : 121 Those who do not love to serve the Guru are the most thieving of thieves. ||2|| 1170 : 122 When the Guru is pleased, He blesses the mortals with loving devotional worship of the Lord. 1170 : 123 When the Guru is pleased, the mortal obtains a place in the Mansion of the Lord's Presence. Raag Basant − Part 003 15

1170 : 124 So renounce slander, and awaken in devotional worship of the Lord. 1170 : 125 Devotion to the Lord is wonderful; it comes through good karma and destiny. ||3|| 1170 : 126 The Guru unites in union with the Lord, and grants the gift of the Name. 1170 : 127 The Guru loves His Sikhs, day and night. 1170 : 128 They obtain the fruit of the Naam, when the Guru's favor is bestowed. 1170 : 129 Says Nanak, those who receive it are very rare indeed. ||4||7|| 1170 : 130 Basant, Third Mehl, Ik−Tukas: 1170 : 131 When it pleases our Lord and Master, His servant serves Him. 1170 : 132 He remains dead while yet alive, and redeems all his ancestors. ||1|| 1170 : 133 I shall not renounce Your devotional worship, O Lord; what does it matter if people laugh at me? Raag Basant − Part 003 16

1170 : 134 The True Name abides within my heart. ||1||Pause|| 1170 : 135 Just as the mortal remains engrossed in attachment to Maya, 1170 : 136 so does the Lord's humble Saint remain absorbed in the Lord's Name. ||2|| 1170 : 137 I am foolish and ignorant, O Lord; please be merciful to me. 1170 : 138 May I remain in Your Sanctuary. ||3|| 1170 : 139 Says Nanak, worldly affairs are fruitless. 1170 : 140 Only by Guru's Grace does one receive the Nectar of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4||8|| 1170 : 141 First Mehl, Basant Hindol, Second House: 1170 : 142 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1170 : 143 O Brahmin, you worship and believe in your stone−god, and wear your ceremonial rosary Raag Basant − Part 003 17
beads. 1170 : 144 Chant the Name of the Lord. Build your boat, and pray, "O Merciful Lord, please be merciful to me."||1|| −− Raag Basant − Part 003 −− Raag Basant − Part 003 18

Raag Basant − Part 004 1171 : 145 Why do you irrigate the barren, alkaline soil? You are wasting your life away! 1171 : 146 This wall of mud is crumbling. Why bother to patch it with plaster? ||1||Pause|| 1171 : 147 Let your hands be the buckets, strung on the chain, and yoke the mind as the ox to pull it; draw the water up from the well. 1171 : 148 Irrigate your fields with the Ambrosial Nectar, and you shall be owned by God the Gardener. ||2|| 1171 : 149 Let sexual desire and anger be your two shovels, to dig up the dirt of your farm, O Siblings of Destiny. 1171 : 150 The more you dig, the more peace you shall find. Your past actions cannot be erased. ||3|| 1171 : 151 The crane is again transformed into a swan, if You so will, O Merciful Lord. 1171 : 152 Prays Nanak, the slave of Your slaves: O Merciful Lord, have mercy on me. ||4||1||9|| 1171 : 153 19

Basant, First Mehl, Hindol: 1171 : 154 In the House of the Husband Lord − in the world hereafter, everything is jointly owned; but in this world − in the house of the soul−bride's parents, the soul−bride owns them separately. 1171 : 155 She herself is ill−mannered; how can she blame anyone else? She does not know how to take care of these things. ||1|| 1171 : 156 O my Lord and Master, I am deluded by doubt. 1171 : 157 I sing the Word which You have written; I do not know any other Word. ||1||Pause|| 1171 : 158 She alone is known as the Lord's bride, who embroiders her gown in the Name. 1171 : 159 She who preserves and protects the home of her own heart and does not taste of evil, shall be the Beloved of her Husband Lord. ||2|| 1171 : 160 If you are a learned and wise religious scholar, then make a boat of the letters of the Lord's Name. 1171 : 161 Prays Nanak, the One Lord shall carry you across, if you merge in the True Lord. ||3||2||10|| 1171 : 162 Raag Basant − Part 004 20

Basant Hindol, First Mehl: 1171 : 163 The king is just a boy, and his city is vulnerable. He is in love with his wicked enemies. 1171 : 164 He reads of his two mothers and his two fathers; O Pandit, reflect on this. ||1|| 1171 : 165 O Master Pandit, teach me about this. 1171 : 166 How can I obtain the Lord of life? ||1||Pause|| 1171 : 167 There is fire within the plants which bloom; the ocean is tied into a bundle. 1171 : 168 The sun and the moon dwell in the same home in the sky. You have not obtained this knowledge. ||2|| 1171 : 169 One who knows the All−pervading Lord, eats up the one mother − Maya. 1171 : 170 Know that the sign of such a person is that he gathers the wealth of compassion. ||3|| 1171 : 171 The mind lives with those who do not listen, and do not admit what they eat. Raag Basant − Part 004 21

1171 : 172 Prays Nanak, the slave of the Lord's slave: one instant the mind is huge, and the next instant, it is tiny. ||4||3||11|| 1171 : 173 Basant Hindol, First Mehl: 1171 : 174 The Guru is the True Banker, the Giver of peace; He unites the mortal with the Lord, and satisfies his hunger. 1171 : 175 Granting His Grace, He implants devotional worship of the Lord within; and then night and day, we sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||1|| 1171 : 176 O my mind, do not forget the Lord; keep Him in your consciousness. 1171 : 177 Without the Guru, no one is liberated anywhere in the three worlds. The Gurmukh obtains the Lord's Name. ||1||Pause|| 1171 : 178 Without devotional worship, the True Guru is not obtained. Without good destiny, devotional worship of the Lord is not obtained. 1171 : 179 Without good destiny, the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, is not obtained. By the grace of one's good karma, the Lord's Name is received. ||2|| 1171 : 180 Raag Basant − Part 004 22

In each and every heart, the Lord is hidden; He creates and watches over all. He reveals Himself in the humble, Saintly Gurmukhs. 1171 : 181 Those who chant the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, are drenched with the Lord's Love. Their minds are drenched with the Ambrosial Water of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||3|| −− Raag Basant − Part 004 −− Raag Basant − Part 004 23

Raag Basant − Part 005 1172 : 182 Those who are blessed with the glory of the Lord's Throne − those Gurmukhs are renowned as supreme. 1172 : 183 Touching the philosopher's stone, they themselves becomes the philosopher's stone; they become the companions of the Lord, the Guru. ||4||4||12|| 1172 : 184 Basant, Third Mehl, First House, Du−Tukas: 1172 : 185 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1172 : 186 Throughout the months and the seasons, the Lord is always in bloom. 1172 : 187 He rejuvenates all beings and creatures. 1172 : 188 What can I say? I am just a worm. 1172 : 189 No one has found Your beginning or Your end, O Lord. ||1|| 1172 : 190 Those who serve You, Lord, 24

1172 : 191 obtain the greatest peace; their souls are so divine. ||1||Pause|| 1172 : 192 If the Lord is merciful, then the mortal is allowed to serve Him. 1172 : 193 By Guru's Grace, he remains dead while yet alive. 1172 : 194 Night and day, he chants the True Name; 1172 : 195 in this way, he crosses over the treacherous world−ocean. ||2|| 1172 : 196 The Creator created both poison and nectar. 1172 : 197 He attached these two fruits to the world−plant. 1172 : 198 The Creator Himself is the Doer, the Cause of all. 1172 : 199 He feeds all as He pleases. ||3|| 1172 : 200 O Nanak, when He casts His Glance of Grace, Raag Basant − Part 005 25

1172 : 201 He Himself bestows His Ambrosial Naam. 1172 : 202 Thus, the desire for sin and corruption is ended. 1172 : 203 The Lord Himself carries out His Own Will. ||4||1|| 1172 : 204 Basant, Third Mehl: 1172 : 205 Those who are attuned to the True Lord's Name are happy and exalted. 1172 : 206 Take pity on me, O God, Merciful to the meek. 1172 : 207 Without Him, I have no other at all. 1172 : 208 As it pleases His Will, He keeps me. ||1|| 1172 : 209 The Guru, the Lord, is pleasing to my mind. 1172 : 210 I cannot even survive, without the Blessed Vision of His Darshan. But I shall easily unite with the Guru, if He unites me in His Union. ||1||Pause|| Raag Basant − Part 005 26

1172 : 211 The greedy mind is enticed by greed. 1172 : 212 Forgetting the Lord, it regrets and repents in the end. 1172 : 213 The separated ones are reunited, when they are inspired to serve the Guru. 1172 : 214 They are blessed with the Lord's Name − such is the destiny written on their foreheads. ||2|| 1172 : 215 This body is built of air and water. 1172 : 216 The body is afflicted with the terribly painful illness of egotism. 1172 : 217 The Gurmukh has the Medicine: singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name. 1172 : 218 Granting His Grace, the Guru has cured the illness. ||3|| 1172 : 219 The four evils are the four rivers of fire flowing through the body. 1172 : 220 It is burning in desire, and burning in egotism. Raag Basant − Part 005 27

1172 : 221 Those whom the Guru protects and saves are very fortunate. 1172 : 222 Servant Nanak enshrines the Ambrosial Name of the Lord in his heart. ||4||2|| 1172 : 223 Basant, Third Mehl: 1172 : 224 One who serves the Lord is the Lord's person. 1172 : 225 He dwells in intuitive peace, and never suffers in sorrow. 1172 : 226 The self−willed manmukhs are dead; the Lord is not within their minds. 1172 : 227 They die and die again and again, and are reincarnated, only to die once more. ||1|| 1172 : 228 They alone are alive, whose minds are filled with the Lord. 1172 : 229 They contemplate the True Lord, and are absorbed in the True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1172 : 230 Those who do not serve the Lord are far away from the Lord. Raag Basant − Part 005 28

1172 : 231 They wander in foreign lands, with dust thrown on their heads. 1172 : 232 The Lord Himself enjoins His humble servants to serve Him. 1172 : 233 They live in peace forever, and have no greed at all. ||2|| −− Raag Basant − Part 005 −− Raag Basant − Part 005 29

Raag Basant − Part 006 1173 : 234 When the Lord bestows His Glance of Grace, egotism is eradicated. 1173 : 235 Then, the mortal is honored in the Court of the True Lord. 1173 : 236 He sees the Dear Lord always close at hand, ever−present. 1173 : 237 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, he sees the Lord pervading and permeating all. ||3|| 1173 : 238 The Lord cherishes all beings and creatures. 1173 : 239 By Guru's Grace, contemplate Him forever. 1173 : 240 You shall go to your true home in the Lord's Court with honor. 1173 : 241 O Nanak, through the Naam, the Name of the Lord, you shall be blessed with glorious greatness. ||4||3|| 1173 : 242 Basant, Third Mehl: 30

1173 : 243 One who worships the Lord within his mind, 1173 : 244 sees the One and Only Lord, and no other. 1173 : 245 People in duality suffer terrible pain. 1173 : 246 The True Guru has shown me the One Lord. ||1|| 1173 : 247 My God is in bloom, forever in spring. 1173 : 248 This mind blossoms forth, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe. ||1||Pause|| 1173 : 249 So consult the Guru, and reflect upon His wisdom; 1173 : 250 then, you shall be in love with the True Lord God. 1173 : 251 Abandon your self−conceit, and be His loving servant. 1173 : 252 Then, the Life of the World shall come to dwell in your mind. ||2|| Raag Basant − Part 006 31

1173 : 253 Worship Him with devotion, and see Him always ever−present, close at hand. 1173 : 254 My God is forever permeating and pervading all. 1173 : 255 Only a rare few know the mystery of this devotional worship. 1173 : 256 My God is the Enlightener of all souls. ||3|| 1173 : 257 The True Guru Himself unites us in His Union. 1173 : 258 He Himself links our consciousness to the Lord, the Life of the World. 1173 : 259 Thus, our minds and bodies are rejuvenated with intuitive ease. 1173 : 260 O Nanak, through the Naam, the Name of the Lord, we remain attuned to the String of His Love. ||4||4|| 1173 : 261 Basant, Third Mehl: 1173 : 262 The Lord is the Lover of His devotees; He dwells within their minds, Raag Basant − Part 006 32

1173 : 263 by Guru's Grace, with intuitive ease. 1173 : 264 Through devotional worship, self−conceit is eradicated from within, 1173 : 265 and then, one meets the True Lord. ||1|| 1173 : 266 His devotees are forever beauteous at the Door of the Lord God. 1173 : 267 Loving the Guru, they have love and affection for the True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1173 : 268 That humble being who worships the Lord with devotion becomes immaculate and pure. 1173 : 269 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, egotism is eradicated from within. 1173 : 270 The Dear Lord Himself comes to dwell within the mind, 1173 : 271 and the mortal remains immersed in peace, tranquility and intuitive ease. ||2|| 1173 : 272 Those who are imbued with Truth, are forever in the bloom of spring. Raag Basant − Part 006 33

1173 : 273 Their minds and bodies are rejuvenated, uttering the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe. 1173 : 274 Without the Lord's Name, the world is dry and parched. 1173 : 275 It burns in the fire of desire, over and over again. ||3|| 1173 : 276 One who does only that which is pleasing to the Dear Lord 1173 : 277 − his body is forever at peace, and his consciousness is attached to the Lord's Will. 1173 : 278 He serves His God with intuitive ease. 1173 : 279 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, comes to abide in his mind. ||4||5|| 1173 : 280 Basant, Third Mehl: 1173 : 281 Attachment to Maya is burnt away by the Word of the Shabad. 1173 : 282 The mind and body are rejuvenated by the Love of the True Guru. Raag Basant − Part 006 34

1173 : 283 The tree bears fruit at the Lord's Door, 1173 : 284 in love with the True Bani of the Guru's Word, and the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 1173 : 285 This mind is rejuvenated, with intuitive ease; 1173 : 286 loving the True Guru, it bears the fruit of truth. ||1||Pause|| 1173 : 287 He Himself is near, and He Himself is far away. 1173 : 288 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, He is seen to be ever−present, close at hand. 1173 : 289 The plants have blossomed forth, giving a dense shade. 1173 : 290 The Gurmukh blossoms forth, with intuitive ease. ||2|| 1173 : 291 Night and day, he sings the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises, day and night. 1173 : 292 The True Guru drives out sin and doubt from within. Raag Basant − Part 006 35
−− Raag Basant − Part 006 −− Raag Basant − Part 006 36

Raag Basant − Part 007 1174 : 293 Gazing upon the wonder of God's Creation, I am wonder−struck and amazed. 1174 : 294 The Gurmukh obtains the Naam, the Name of the Lord, by His Grace. ||3|| 1174 : 295 The Creator Himself enjoys all delights. 1174 : 296 Whatever He does, surely comes to pass. 1174 : 297 He is the Great Giver; He has no greed at all. 1174 : 298 O Nanak, living the Word of the Shabad, the mortal meets with God. ||4||6|| 1174 : 299 Basant, Third Mehl: 1174 : 300 By perfect destiny, one acts in truth. 1174 : 301 Remembering the One Lord, one does not have to enter the cycle of reincarnation. 37

1174 : 302 Fruitful is the coming into the world, and the life of one 1174 : 303 who remains intuitively absorbed in the True Name. ||1|| 1174 : 304 The Gurmukh acts, lovingly attuned to the Lord. 1174 : 305 Be dedicated to the Lord's Name, and eradicate self−conceit from within. ||1||Pause|| 1174 : 306 True is the speech of that humble being; 1174 : 307 through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, it is spread throughout the world. 1174 : 308 Throughout the four ages, his fame and glory spread. 1174 : 309 Imbued with the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the Lord's humble servant is recognized and renowned. ||2|| 1174 : 310 Some remain lovingly attuned to the True Word of the Shabad. 1174 : 311 True are those humble beings who love the True Lord. Raag Basant − Part 007 38

1174 : 312 They meditate on the True Lord, and behold Him near at hand, ever−present. 1174 : 313 They are the dust of the lotus feet of the humble Saints. ||3|| 1174 : 314 There is only One Creator Lord; there is no other at all. 1174 : 315 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, comes Union with the Lord. 1174 : 316 Whoever serves the True Lord finds joy. 1174 : 317 O Nanak, he is intuitively absorbed in the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4||7|| 1174 : 318 Basant, Third Mehl: 1174 : 319 The Lord's humble servant worships Him, and beholds Him ever−present, near at hand. 1174 : 320 He is the dust of the lotus feet of the humble Saints. 1174 : 321 Those who remain lovingly attuned to the Lord forever Raag Basant − Part 007 39

1174 : 322 are blessed with understanding by the Perfect True Guru. ||1|| 1174 : 323 How rare are those who become the slave of the Lord's slaves. 1174 : 324 They attain the supreme status. ||1||Pause|| 1174 : 325 So serve the One Lord, and no other. 1174 : 326 Serving Him, eternal peace is obtained. 1174 : 327 He does not die; He does not come and go in reincarnation. 1174 : 328 Why should I serve any other than Him, O my mother? ||2|| 1174 : 329 True are those humble beings who realize the True Lord. 1174 : 330 Conquering their self−conceit, they merge intuitively into the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1174 : 331 The Gurmukhs gather in the Naam. Raag Basant − Part 007 40

1174 : 332 Their minds are immaculate, and their reputations are immaculate. ||3|| 1174 : 333 Know the Lord, who gave you spiritual wisdom, 1174 : 334 and realize the One God, through the True Word of the Shabad. 1174 : 335 When the mortal tastes the sublime essence of the Lord, he becomes pure and holy. 1174 : 336 O Nanak, those who are imbued with the Naam − their reputations are true. ||4||8|| 1174 : 337 Basant, Third Mehl: 1174 : 338 Those who are imbued with the Naam, the Name of the Lord − their generations are redeemed and saved. 1174 : 339 True is their speech; they love the Naam. 1174 : 340 Why have the wandering self−willed manmukhs even come into the world? 1174 : 341 Forgetting the Naam, the mortals waste their lives away. ||1|| Raag Basant − Part 007 41
